Granada.tour_name: Alhambra, Nasrid Palaces & Generalife Fast-Track Tour
Granada.description: The essential, sell-out tour. Includes guaranteed skip-the-line access to the entire complex: Nasrid Palaces, Generalife Gardens, and Alcazaba, with an expert historian guide.

Granada.tour_name: Sunset Walking Tour of Albaicín & Sacromonte
Granada.description: Explore the narrow, jasmine-scented streets of the Arab quarter and the gypsy caves of Sacromonte. Ends with the iconic sunset view of the Alhambra from Mirador de San Nicolás.

Seville.description: A comprehensive 3-hour tour covering Seville's UNESCO trio. Includes priority access to the Royal Palace (Game of Thrones filming location) and the world's largest Gothic cathedral.

Seville.tour_name: Authentic Tapas Crawl in Triana Neighborhood
Seville.description: Cross the river to the historic Triana district. Visit a local market and 3 traditional bars to taste Andalusia's best cured ham, fried fish, and local wines.

Córdoba.description: Skip the line to explore one of the world's most unique monuments—a forest of 856 columns inside a former mosque converted into a cathedral.

Córdoba.tour_name: Patios of Córdoba & Jewish Quarter Tour
Córdoba.description: Discover the famous flower-filled patios of Córdoba (a UNESCO heritage tradition) and wander the winding streets of the medieval Jewish Quarter and Synagogue.

Málaga.tour_name: Caminito del Rey Guided Day Trip (with Bus)
Málaga.description: The ultimate nature experience. Includes transport from Málaga city center and a guided safe walk along the famous 'King's Little Path' hanging 100m high in the gorge.

Málaga.tour_name: Complete Málaga: Alcazaba, Roman Theatre & Cathedral
Málaga.description: A deep dive into Málaga's history, visiting the Roman ruins at the foot of the hill and the beautifully preserved Moorish fortress palace above.

Cádiz.tour_name: Cádiz Old Town & Tavira Tower Camera Obscura
Cádiz.description: Climb the highest watchtower in the city for 360-degree views and a unique 'Camera Obscura' session, followed by a walk through the oldest city in Western Europe.
Taste the famous 'pescaíto frito' (fried fish) and sherry wines at the bustling Central Market, guided by a local foodie expert.

Ronda.tour_name: Ronda Walking Tour: Puente Nuevo & Bullring
Ronda.description: Stand on the iconic 'New Bridge' spanning the deep El Tajo gorge and visit the Plaza de Toros, one of the oldest and most historically significant bullrings in Spain.

Ronda.tour_name: Organic Olive Oil Tour & Tasting at Local Estate
Ronda.description: Escape the town center to visit a nearby traditional 'finca'. Learn about olive oil production and enjoy a tasting session with views of the Sierra de Grazalema.

Jerez de la Frontera.tour_name: Sherry Winery Tour & Tasting (Tio Pepe or similar)
Jerez de la Frontera.description: No visit to Jerez is complete without sherry. Tour a cathedral-like bodega, learn the solera aging system, and taste various styles from Fino to Pedro Ximénez.

Jerez de la Frontera.tour_name: Royal Andalusian School of Equestrian Art Show
Jerez de la Frontera.description: Watch the famous 'How the Andalusian Horses Dance' ballet. An equestrian spectacle showcasing classical dressage in a stunning 19th-century palace setting.

Marbella.tour_name: Marbella Old Town & Tapas Walking Tour
Marbella.description: Explore the charming historic center with its whitewashed walls and flower pots, stopping at hidden bodegas for tapas away from the tourist traps of Puerto Banús.

Marbella.tour_name: Luxury Catamaran Cruise from Puerto Banús
Marbella.description: Experience the glamour of Marbella from the sea. A relaxing sailing trip along the Golden Mile with drinks, snacks, and swimming stops.

Nerja.description: Visit the spectacular prehistoric Nerja Caves (home to the world's largest stalactite) and the nearby white village of Frigiliana, voted the prettiest in Andalusia.

Nerja.tour_name: Kayaking & Snorkeling in Maro-Cerro Gordo Cliffs
Nerja.description: Paddle through crystal-clear waters along the wildly beautiful cliffs of Maro. Includes stops for snorkeling in hidden coves accessible only by sea.

Antequera.tour_name: Dolmens of Antequera & El Torcal Nature Reserve
Antequera.description: A dual-site tour visiting the UNESCO World Heritage Dolmens (megalithic tombs) and a guided hike through the surreal limestone rock formations of El Torcal.
Climb up to the Moorish Alcazaba for panoramic views and explore the city's incredible density of Renaissance churches and convents.

Tarifa.tour_name: Whale & Dolphin Watching in the Strait
Tarifa.description: Navigate the waters between Europe and Africa. A high chance to see Pilot Whales, Bottlenose Dolphins, and even Orcas (in summer) in their natural habitat.

Tarifa.tour_name: Tangier Day Trip by Ferry from Tarifa
Tarifa.description: Take the fast ferry across the strait for a full day in Morocco. Includes a guided walk of the Kasbah, Medina, and a traditional Moroccan lunch.

Gibraltar.tour_name: Rock of Gibraltar Tour: Monkeys & St. Michael's Cave
Gibraltar.description: The classic tour of the Rock. Meet the famous Barbary Macaques (monkeys), visit the stunning St. Michael's Cave, and enjoy views of two continents.

Gibraltar.tour_name: Dolphin Watching Cruise in Gibraltar Bay
Gibraltar.description: A specialized boat tour to see the wild dolphins that live in the bay. Offers unique views of the Rock and the Spanish coastline from the water.

Úbeda.description: A guided walk through the 'Queen of the Olive Groves.' Focuses on the pristine Renaissance architecture of Vázquez de Molina Square and the Sacra Capilla del Salvador.
Úbeda is the capital of olive oil. Visit an 'Almazara' (mill) to learn the production process and taste some of the world's best Extra Virgin Olive Oils.

Baeza.tour_name: Baeza UNESCO World Heritage Walking Tour
Baeza.description: Stroll through the poetic streets where Antonio Machado lived. Visit the Cathedral, the Jabalquinto Palace, and the Old University in this quiet Renaissance gem.
A comprehensive tour covering both UNESCO sister cities in one day. Perfect for travelers who want to see the highlights of the Spanish Renaissance efficiently.

Almería.description: Explore the volcanic cliffs and hidden beaches of Cabo de Gata Natural Park. Visit the salt flats (often with flamingos) and the iconic Mermaid's Reef.

Almería.tour_name: Oasys MiniHollywood Western Theme Park Ticket
Almería.description: Visit the actual sets of famous Spaghetti Western movies in the Tabernas Desert. Includes cowboy stunt shows, a zoo, and access to the pool areas.
